P086801.project_name: SL Bumbuna Hydroelectric Environmental and Social Management project

project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Bumbuna Hydroelectric Environmental and Social Management Project are to assist the recipient in completing the Bumbuna Hydroelectric Project (BHP) in an environmentally and socially sustainable manner through the carrying out of measures to avoid, mitigate, reduce, and offset the adverse environmental and social impacts of the BHP in the project area; and to enhance the environmental and social benefits to be derived from the BHP in the project area. The restructuring will reallocate the funds that were originally set aside to support the Partial Risk Guarantee (PRG) to the International Development Association (IDA) grant to cover a funding gap in the implementation of critical safeguard activities under components B and C. The funding gap is the result of higher than anticipated costs for originally planned safeguard activities, the inclusion of additional safeguard activities that had not been originally planned for financing through the IDA grant, and the shortfall created by the unavailability of funding from carbon offsets that were expected to cover safeguards-related work when the project was originally approved by the Board in 2005. Moreover, the restructuring proposes to amend the project development objective and associated indicators to reflect these changes, and to extend the project closing date by 24 months from September 30, 2010, to September 30, 2012, to complete the remaining project activities under components B and C.
